intro: Conringia clavata, commonly known as the clustered bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered pods that resemble bladders, hence its common name. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Conringia clavata is an annual herb that produces yellow flowers and is often found in the western United States.
